Multi-stage, stratified sample. At the first stage settlements were categorized based on their ethnic composition. Three types were identified: the one with Hungarian majority, the parity model, and the one with Romanian majority. Samples were taken from all three types, considering the settlement size as well. Within the settlements the Leslie Kish-method was used to select a sample, treating the Hungarians or Romanians living in the specific settlement as separate sampling units.
